ethnicity_tooltip: We use the term ethnicity to describe groups of people who have shared ideas of culture, language, history, and customs. A person may have more than one ethnicity, and it can be different to their nationality or citizenship status.

race_tooltip: Appearance refers to the grouping of people into broad categories based on differences in physical appearance. It has no proven basis in scientific fact, and forms the basis of racism – that is, the use of racial differences to establish a social hierarchy and system of power that privileges or advantages certain groups and unfairly disadvantage other groups. Appearance can be both something that a person identifies with and something that is assigned to them by others.

now_registered: You and [organization´s name] are now registered in Diversity Atlas. You can login into Diversity Atlas dashboard and start inviting people to join your team.
tier_levels_explanation: Choose your organization tier levels. Any tier can only invite and manage the tier(s) bellow. The tier levels will help you divide your organization into sub-group (ex: Departments, Classes, etc) for a better detail analysis.

registering_is_easy: Registering is easy and takes only a few minutes, the results of the survey do not include names or email addresses.
diversity_index_tooltip: The diversity index is a weighted index that measures an organizations’s overall level of cultural diversity  based on the 4 pillars of ethnicity ( 30% ), country of birth(23%), languages(23%) and worldview/religion(24%). It provides a framework for organizations to periodically track their overall level of diversity (N.B It is not a score or ranking).
